intro: Pimelea phylicoides, commonly known as the silverleaf pimelea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its narrow, silver-green leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry forests, preferring well-drained soils. It is a shrub that can reach up to 1 meter in height, with a compact and bushy growth habit. Pimelea phylicoides is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
